intro: Cirsium jucundum, commonly known as the cheerful thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Cirsium jucundum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
